Line 72: Line 72:
===Linux===
===Linux===
â
There have been several indications at this point that a Linux port is in the works. Specifically, an end-user discovered an option for Linux as a runtime platform in Unity itself<ref>{{cite web | url=http://forum.unity3d.com/threads/5891-Linux-Web-Player?p=518025&viewfull=1#post518025 | title=Linux Runtime Option Discovered}}</ref> and work on a Linux port was later confirmed by a Unity Technologies developer<ref>{{cite web | url=http://forum.unity3d.com/threads/5891-Linux-Web-Player?p=519300&viewfull=1#post519300 | title=Unity Technologies developer confirms Linux Port In-Progress}}</ref>. A prototype of a web-plugin for Firefox on Linux was also blogged about on Unity 3D's corporate blog<ref>{{cite web | url=http://blogs.unity3d.com/2011/03/24/ninjacamp-iii-foxes-and-penguins-unite/ | title=NinjaCamp III: Foxes and Penguins Unite}}</ref> and another Unity Technologies employee has publicly indicated that work has been done on a Linux port<ref>{{cite web | url=http://answers.unity3d.com/questions/118406/linux-support.html | title=Linux Support on Unity Answers Site}}</ref>. However, Unity Technologies has not made any official public statement regarding status of the port or an estimated release date.
+
There have been several indications at this point that a [[Linux]] port is in the works. Specifically, an end-user discovered an option for Linux as a runtime platform in Unity itself<ref>{{cite web | url=http://forum.unity3d.com/threads/5891-Linux-Web-Player?p=518025&viewfull=1#post518025 | title=Linux Runtime Option Discovered}}</ref> and work on a Linux port was later confirmed by a Unity Technologies developer<ref>{{cite web | url=http://forum.unity3d.com/threads/5891-Linux-Web-Player?p=519300&viewfull=1#post519300 | title=Unity Technologies developer confirms Linux Port In-Progress}}</ref>. A prototype of a web-plugin for Firefox on Linux was also blogged about on Unity 3D's corporate blog<ref>{{cite web | url=http://blogs.unity3d.com/2011/03/24/ninjacamp-iii-foxes-and-penguins-unite/ | title=NinjaCamp III: Foxes and Penguins Unite}}</ref> and another Unity Technologies employee has publicly indicated that work has been done on a Linux port<ref>{{cite web | url=http://answers.unity3d.com/questions/118406/linux-support.html | title=Linux Support on Unity Answers Site}}</ref>. However, Unity Technologies has not made any official public statement regarding status of the port or an estimated release date.
